perturbation.original_text: The term "Affiliate" as used herein with respect to a party means any partnership, joint venture, corporation of other form of enterprise that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with such entity or person. For purposes hereof, "control" means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person or entity, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: The term "Affiliate" as used herein with respect to a party means any partnership, joint venture, corporation of other form of enterprise that directly controls such entity or person. For purposes hereof, "control" means the ownership of voting securities.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliate' includes entities under indirect control and defines 'control' broadly to include influence via contracts. The modified version restricts the definition to only entities under direct control and defines 'control' as solely ownership of voting securities, creating conflicting interpretations.

perturbation.original_text:
Oak Ridge shall be responsible for developing the sales and marketing for the Products and Services;

Oak Ridge shall dedicate sales and marketing personnel to develop the market;
perturbation.changed_text:
Oak Ridge shall be responsible for developing the sales and marketing for the Products and Services;

Oak Ridge will endeavor to dedicate sales and marketing personnel to develop the market;
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that Oak Ridge 'shall dedicate' personnel, creating an obligation. The modified text changes this to 'will endeavor to dedicate,' which introduces ambiguity and makes the dedication of personnel non-binding, creating a conflict if other sections rely on dedicated personnel.

perturbation.original_text: In certain cases, Leclanché may request progress payments, including some element paid at the time of order. In the absence of a specific payment schedule, all payment terms are 30 days net from date of invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: In certain cases, Leclanché may request progress payments, including some element paid at the time of order. In the absence of a specific payment schedule, all payment terms are 60 days net from date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement sets a 30-day net payment term. This is directly contradicted by the modified agreement which sets a 60-day net payment term. It's uncertain which term is followed.
